{"step_by_step_thinking": "The newborn boy was initially tachypneic and had elevated pulmonary artery pressure, which improved with a medication that increases smooth muscle cGMP. The most likely cause of this is a right-to-left shunt due to closure of the ductus arteriosus. The ductus arteriosus normally closes after birth, but in cases of pulmonary hypertension, it may remain open to allow blood to bypass the high-pressure pulmonary circulation. If it closes, blood is forced into the high-pressure pulmonary circulation, leading to hypoxia and cyanosis.
